text: Glanrhyd Hospital is a psychiatric hospital in Pen-y-fai near Bridgend in Wales. It is managed by the Cwm Taf University Health Board. ==History== The hospital, which was designed by William Martin and John Henry Chamberlain in the Gothic Revival style using a linear corridor layout, opened as the Glamorgan County Lunatic Asylum in November 1864. It became the Glamorgan County Mental Hospital in 1922 and it joined the National Health Service as Glanrhyd Hospital in 1948. A new low-secure unit, known as Taith Newydd ("New Journey"), was built on the site in 2014. ==References== Category:Psychiatric hospitals in Wales Category:Hospitals established in 1864 Category:Hospital buildings completed in 1864 Category:Hospitals in Bridgend County Borough Category:NHS hospitals in Wales Category:Cwm Taf Morgannwg University Health Board
